intro: Aylostera froehlichiana, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow flowers with a central disk, surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Aylostera froehlichiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
